intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subcaesium var. subcaesium, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is an herbaceous perennial that produces achenes as its reproductive structures.
